org.lockss.plnmonitor.rdbms

Class DatabaseManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lockss.plnmonitor.rdbms.DatabaseManager

  • public class DatabaseManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Executes SQL queries.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1781 $
    Author:
    Peter Breton, Jim Downing

    • Method Detail

      • queryTable

        public static TableRowIterator queryTable(NewAuthenticatedWebSession userSession,
                                          java.lang.String table,
                                          java.lang.String query,
                                          java.lang.Object... parameters)
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Return an iterator with the results of the query. The table parameter indicates the type of result. If table is null, the column names are read from the ResultSetMetaData.
        Parameters:
        context - The context object
        table - The name of the table which results
        query - The SQL query
        parameters - A set of SQL parameters to be included in query. The order of the parameters must correspond to the order of their reference within the query.
        Returns:
        A TableRowIterator with the results of the query
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database error occurs

      • query

        public static TableRowIterator query(NewAuthenticatedWebSession userSession,
                                     java.lang.String query,
                                     java.lang.Object... parameters)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Return an iterator with the results of the query.
        Parameters:
        userSession - The userSession object
        query - The SQL query
        parameters - A set of SQL parameters to be included in query. The order of the parameters must correspond to the order of their reference within the query.
        Returns:
        A TableRowIterator with the results of the query
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database error occurs

      • queryPreparedTable

        public static TableRowIterator queryPreparedTable(java.lang.String table,
                                                  java.sql.PreparedStatement statement)
                                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Return an iterator with the results of executing statement. The table parameter indicates the type of result. If table is null, the column names are read from the ResultSetMetaData. The userSession is that of the connection which was used to create the statement.
        Parameters:
        statement - The prepared statement to execute.
        table - The name of the table which results
        parameters - A set of SQL parameters to be included in query. The order of the parameters must correspond to the order of their reference within the query.
        Returns:
        A TableRowIterator with the results of the query
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database error occurs

      • queryPrepared

        public static TableRowIterator queryPrepared(java.sql.PreparedStatement statement)
                                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Return an iterator with the results of executing statement. The userSession is that of the connection which was used to create the statement.
        Parameters:
        statement - The prepared statement to execute.
        Returns:
        A TableRowIterator with the results of the query
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database error occurs

      • querySingle

        public static TableRow querySingle(NewAuthenticatedWebSession userSession,
                                   java.lang.String query,
                                   java.lang.Object... parameters)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Return the single row result to this query, or null if no result. If more than one row results, only the first is returned.
        Parameters:
        userSession - Current DSpace userSession
        query - The SQL query
        parameters - A set of SQL parameters to be included in query. The order of the parameters must correspond to the order of their reference within the query.
        Returns:
        A TableRow object, or null if no result
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database error occurs

                                        java.lang.String table,

                                        java.lang.Object... parameters)
                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Return the single row result to this query, or null if no result. If more than one row results, only the first is returned.
        Parameters:
        userSession - Current DSpace userSession
        table - The name of the table which results
        query - The SQL query
        parameters - A set of SQL parameters to be included in query. The order of the parameters must correspond to the order of their reference within the query.
        Returns:
        A TableRow object, or null if no result
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database error occurs

      • updateQuery

        public static int updateQuery(NewAuthenticatedWebSession userSession,
                              java.lang.String query,
                              java.lang.Object... parameters)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Execute an update, insert or delete query. Returns the number of rows affected by the query.
        Parameters:
        userSession - Current DSpace userSession
        query - The SQL query to execute
        parameters - A set of SQL parameters to be included in query. The order of the parameters must correspond to the order of their reference within the query.
        Returns:
        The number of rows affected by the query.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database error occurs

                              java.lang.String table)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Create a new row in the given table, and assigns a unique id.
        Parameters:
        userSession - Current DSpace userSession
        table - The RDBMS table in which to create the new row
        Returns:
        The newly created row
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • find

        public static TableRow find(NewAuthenticatedWebSession userSession,
                            java.lang.String table,
                            int id)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Find a table row by its primary key. Returns the row, or null if no row with that primary key value exists.
        Parameters:
        userSession - Current DSpace userSession
        table - The table in which to find the row
        id - The primary key value
        Returns:
        The row resulting from the query, or null if no row with that primary key value exists.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database error occurs

      • findByUnique

        public static TableRow findByUnique(NewAuthenticatedWebSession userSession,
                                    java.lang.String table,
                                    java.lang.String column,
                                    java.lang.String value)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Find a table row by a unique value. Returns the row, or null if no row with that primary key value exists. If multiple rows with the value exist, one is returned.
        Parameters:
        userSession - Current DSpace userSession
        table - The table to use to find the object
        column - The name of the unique column
        value - The value of the unique column
        Returns:
        The row resulting from the query, or null if no row with that value exists.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database error occurs

      • delete

        public static int delete(NewAuthenticatedWebSession userSession,
                         java.lang.String table,
                         int id)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Delete a table row via its primary key. Returns the number of rows deleted.
        Parameters:
        userSession - Current DSpace userSession
        table - The table to delete from
        id - The primary key value
        Returns:
        The number of rows deleted
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database error occurs

      • deleteByValue

        public static int deleteByValue(NewAuthenticatedWebSession userSession,
                                java.lang.String table,
                                java.lang.String column,
                                java.lang.Object value)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Delete all table rows with the given value. Returns the number of rows deleted.
        Parameters:
        userSession - Current DSpace userSession
        table - The table to delete from
        column - The name of the column
        value - The value of the column
        Returns:
        The number of rows deleted
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database error occurs

      • getConnection

        public static java.sql.Connection getConnection()
                                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Obtain an RDBMS connection.
        Returns:
        A new database connection.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database error occurs, or a connection cannot be obtained.

      • freeConnection

        public static void freeConnection(java.sql.Connection c)
        Release resources associated with this connection.
        Parameters:
        c - The connection to release

      • row

        public static TableRow row(java.lang.String table)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Create a table row object that can be passed into the insert method, not commonly used unless the table has a referential integrity constraint.
        Parameters:
        table - The RDBMS table in which to create the new row
        Returns:
        The newly created row
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

        Parameters:
        userSession - Current DSpace userSession
        row - The row to insert
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database error occurs

      • update

        public static int update(NewAuthenticatedWebSession userSession,
                         TableRow row)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Update changes to the RDBMS. Note that if the update fails, the values in the row will NOT be reverted.
        Parameters:
        userSession - Current DSpace userSession
        row - The row to update
        Returns:
        The number of rows affected (1 or 0)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database error occurs

      • delete

        public static int delete(NewAuthenticatedWebSession userSession,
                         TableRow row)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Delete row from the RDBMS.
        Parameters:
        userSession - Current DSpace userSession
        row - The row to delete
        Returns:
        The number of rows affected (1 or 0)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database error occurs

      • loadSql

        public static void loadSql(java.lang.String sql)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Load SQL into the RDBMS.
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL to load. throws SQLException If a database error occurs
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • loadSql

        public static void loadSql(java.io.Reader r)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException,
                           java.io.IOException
        Load SQL from a reader into the RDBMS.
        Parameters:
        r - The Reader from which to read the SQL.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database error occurs
        java.io.IOException - If an error occurs obtaining data from the reader

      • loadSql

        public static void loadSql(java.lang.String dbname,
                           java.io.Reader r)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException,
                           java.io.IOException
        Load SQL from a reader into the RDBMS.
        Parameters:
        database - The name of the database into which SQL needs to be loaded
        reader - The Reader from which to read the SQL.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database error occurs
        java.io.IOException - If an error occurs obtaining data from the reader

      • getPrimaryKeyColumn

        public static java.lang.String getPrimaryKeyColumn(TableRow row)
                                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Return the name of the primary key column. We assume there's only one primary key per table; if there are more, only the first one will be returned.
        Parameters:
        row - The TableRow to return the primary key for.
        Returns:
        The name of the primary key column, or null if the row has no primary key.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database error occurs
